description:
Welcome!
 
 
 
   Our Growth is Creating Great Opportunities!
   
   Our team is expanding, and we want to hire the most talented people we can. Continued success depends on it! Once you've had a chance to explore our current open positions, apply to the ones you feel suit you best and keep track of both your progress in the selection process, and new postings that might interest you!
   
   Thanks for your interest in working on our team!
 
 
   The R&D Optics Engineer will primarily be responsible for working in collaboration with the silicon photonics design team to provide system models and experimental design validation regarding the performance of Adva's high speed coherent optical engines coupled with state-of-the-art DSPs.
 
 
 
   Principal Tasks
 
 
   R&D engineer for Photonics Integration team
   Knowledge of optical packaging concepts and test of high speed RF/optical components
   Experience with test automation software: Matlab, Labview or similar
   Experience with silicon photonics (SiP) technologies
   Experience with advanced coherent DSP capabilities and their use is highly desirable.
   Develop and/or specify lab equipment required for die level SiP testing
   Perform die level DVT on SiP using grating couplers, fiber arrays, RF/DC probes, and sub-micron translation stages/hexapod
   Perform SiP module level DVT using advanced coherent DSPs, AWGs, OMAs, VNAs
   Develop clear and concise test plans for transceiver DVT and Qualification test results (English Language)
   Test of opto-electronic components and sub systems (small signal analysis NVA/LCA, wideband BER, scope, AWG measurements, noise/distortion loading, DWDM testbed)
   Provide technical feedback to optical, mechanical, digital, firmware and software engineers to reach interface and packaging objectives.
   Write component and sub system specifications and review vendor specifications (English language)
   Work with vendors on driving product roadmap and specifications
 
 
   Supplementary Tasks
 
 
   Capable of working independently on the assigned design activities with minimal supervision.
   Comprehensive understanding of the product architecture, design, processes, tools, etc. required to perform their assigned design activities.
   Provide internal input into NPI, manufacturing, quality, Operations and Sales
   Identify and mitigate project risks
   Other duties as assigned
 
 
   Customers (Internal & External)
 
 
   Internal
 
 
   Hardware development team in ATL and all Adva employees
 
 
   External
 
 
   All Adva customers
 
 
   Skills/Qualifications/Training/Experience
 
 
   MS or PHD in physics or electrical engineering
   Knowledge in silicon photonics testing for communications applications
   Optical communications systems, Coherent TX/RX, DSP for coherent systems, high speed electrical
   Highly desirable: experience in modeling system impairments in coherent optical systems
 
 
   Requirements & Work Environment
 
 
   Work environment: office and lab environment. Some lifting of test equipment > 25 pounds. Lifting of test equipment into overhead storage shelves.
   Bending over lab benches to view work. Example: viewing microscopes and instrumentation situated on large optical tables.
 
 
   Success Criteria
 
 
   Self-motivated, high degree of responsibility and ownership of work tasks, sense of urgency regarding project schedules while maintaining high level focus on work quality.
 
 
   Team and Department
 
 
   AOE
   R&D Department
 
 
   Licenses or certifications required
 
 
   None
 
 
   Travel requirements
 
 
   <5% Travel
 
 
   <5 % international
   <5% domestic (1-2 times per month)
 
 
   Scope of employment
 
 
   Full Time
   Employee
   Permanent
   Salaried position
   Work authorization or permanent resident of Canada
   Must be authorized to work in Ontario, Canada
 
 
   Primary location of job
 
 
   Ottawa, Ontario Canada
   Office location with work from home opportunities <10% of time when feasible
 
 
   Work schedule
 
 
   M-F Weekdays or as agreed with manager
   Office hours: Monday – Friday (flexible work schedule as agreed with manager)
 
 
   Compensation scheme
 
 
   Goal pay compensation scheme
   
     Base salary + individual goal pay + company goal pay
